text: From tap at The Country Cat Dinnerhouse & Bar, Portland Airport. Aroma consists of sturdy grains, straw, hay and light grassy noble hops. Flavour is light sweet and light to moderate bitter. Body is medium. Refined grainy character, quality Pils as expected from Pfriem.
Draft at Churchkey. Poured a golden yellow color with a foamy off-white head. Very drinkable. Grassy and earthy hops, crisp malts. Light sweetness in the finish.
UPDATED: JUN 1, 2017 Some noble hops like the prince on the long jump. Pours golden with ok head. Crisp finish. Tap at Churchkey.

Bottle from Albertsons. Light golden, small, tight white head. Big grainy aroma, sweet, meadow, grassy, hay. Taste also favors the sweet grain bell, with a nice strain of hop bitterness on the back end. Recalls more of a helles lager in flavor, but does have a nice crisp hops bite at the back.
Golden clear and white foam collar, moderate spice, earth and for all, crisp and effervescent, very Quaffable. Delicious

Parfums frais de céréales, houblons floraux et délicatement citronnés. Gazon et épices. La bouche est fraîche, houblonné avec ce malt qui craque sous la dent. Légère et pétillante avec une texture huileuse. En finale, longue représentation gazonnée et épicée. Facile à boire. Appréciable comme tout.
Draught at coffee shop down the street from Great Notion. Crisp floral hoppy an really good.
Draft @ RateBeer Best 2017. Pours a golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty grainy grassy aroma. Fruity malty grainy grassy flavor. Has a fruity malty grainy grassy citrus finish.
incredibly fresh aromatics of hay, fresh cut grass, flowers, and dewy mountain meadows. refreshing. crisp. good legs --> lip smacking to the very last drop.

Draft. Light golden body with a frothy, white head, diminishing. Aroma of toasted and raw grain, floral hops, grass. The flavor is moderately sweet and lightly bitter. It finishes lightly to moderately sweet and lightly to moderately bitter. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation. Nice floral and herbal hops. A bit on the sweet side and slightly husky. Still, easy drinking.

Bottle in Seattle. Thick, soft white cream. Quite clear light gold. Fresh cut grass, fresh herbal flowery aroma. Light honey flavors, subtle light pils with a creamier body. Moderate clean bitter, a little heavier cream and honey character. Slight bitter crisp finish. Quite nice.

On tap at Beer Baron in Pleasanton. It pours a crystal clear yellow gold color with a creamy white head. The aroma has strong notes of flowers and honeysuckle. Hints of lemon and spice. The flavor has spicy/noble/flowery hops. A little earthy with medium levels of lemongrass bitterness. Dry. This is a good one. It could be a little snappier on the palate, but overall nice.
Yellow gold,lasting white head.Tiny bead.Spicy peppery hop nose & palate, lightly sweet.Hint of fruit. Medium bitter finish, somewhat dry
Draft at Reubens. Very pale yellow light-bodied beer, with strong carbonation. Taste of grass and honey with spicy hops finish. Excellent.
On tap at Cartopia, Portland. Nice golden body with slight head. Nose is hoppy, citrus, some malts too. Taste is maltier, toasty with hoppier notes. Decent.

Refreshing but still substantial. A great warm weather beer with which to socialize.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAY 21, 2016 Damn near flawless! Light honey aroma, light blonde cloudy pour with slight head. Grainy but smooth. Not too much of a bite. A really classy beer, somewhat sticky. The carbonation is average, but it helps give the other flavors room on my palate. A real favorite of mine.

Bottle from Homebrew Stuff... Pours clear straw golden.. Head doesnt last along nearly enough, but not that big of a complaint.. Floral hoppiness.. slightly sweet pils maltiness. Complex/rich but still simple... very clean.. No flaws... incredibly drinkable.

1 pt 9 oz bottle from a good friend bottled 10-15-15. They dont make them like this anymore, kids. Superior. Light, clean, crisp, but full of flavor at the same time. Would crush this all day given the opportunity. Only complaint: could use some more carb. But fuck it, its delicious.
Classic pils - grainy and crisp, with a light to moderate floral hop presence and an underlying pleasant sweetness.

500 ml. bottle purchased at The Beer Mongers in Portland, Oregon. Bottled on 08 18 15 printed on the label. The pour is a clear pale golden with a well formed one inch white head. Tons of fine carbonation bubbles rise from the bottom the glass. The aroma is fresh cereal grain, floral citrus, and some soft sweet malt. The taste is the crisp clean malt profile, cracker grain malt, balanced nicely with drying floral hops. Some bright citrus notes in the beer there as well. As the beer warms, grain gets a bit of a husky character which makes it a bit less clean, but does give some depth. The palate is light bodied, full carbonation, and the clean floral citrus crisp finish. Easy drinking Pils.
16 oz pint- Pours Crystal clear with a geyser of bubbles and a nice lace. Aroma is Crystal malts, biscuty, quality grains. Taste is clean crystal malts, clean and refreshing. Very nice.

Draught at Matts in the Market, 11/4/15.Lovely, bright, white grape juice color with a hint of copper. Good carbonation coursing upwards creating a white head with moderate retention.Delicate floral hops, adding all sorts of aromatics, with light, fresh herbal accents. Just a touch of baked bread is noted in the aroma, with honey and light biscuit being prominent. Pretty much exactly what Im looking for in a pilsner. Clean, with no flaw and not Americanized.The flavor outdoes the aroma by a good margin, which is impressive. Fantastically tart white grape juice notes (a play between hop and the very lightly toasted grain) give way to a delicate honey sweetness that is in turn whisked away by tight carbonation as soft, floral hops linger pleasantly on the finish. Wonderfully attenuated and incredibly drinkable/refreshing. I found Pfriem to be much more successful on draught than in the bottle, which seems to be echoed by other ratings here.  Didnt find any soapiness that some mentioned, nor did I find there to be any excess of hop resin.
500 ml. bottle. Pours a bright, clear pale gold with a nice white head. Aroma of malt, grain, and fruit. Taste is malt, grain, fruit, grass, and floral. Very nice Pilsener!

Bright golden colored body, medium sized white head, spotty lacing. Vibrant florals, backed by honey biscuits, and some fruity esters. Medium to light bodied with moderate to gentle carbonation, mild sweetness, refreshing finish.
Bottle (500ml $4): I had to try this since it won an award recently even though Pilsners are not my favorites. Straw colored with big white head. Hop armoma, light taste, some fruitiness.

LSAT Freedom Trip #199. Bottle shared at a tasting. Clear very pale golden, large foamy off-white head, good retention. Aroma of snappy noble hops and bready malt. The taste is herbal, grassy hops and biscuit malt. Medium bodied, lingering bitterness.
500 ml bottle. Pours a clear yellow/gold with light pillowy head. Aromas of grain, dried apples, and paper. Flavors of grain, bitter nuts and light fruit.

Bottle.

Head is initially average sized, frothy, white, mostly diminishing.
Body is light to medium yellow.

Aroma is lightly malty (toasted grain, husks), moderately hoppy (flowers, herbs), with light notes of metal, lime, and soap.

Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly sweet, lightly acidic, moderately bitter.

Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation, slightly metallic.

This ones a bit metallic and soapy and husky but otherwise has a nice herbal hop bouquet and balance.

Draft. Medium white head atop crystal clear pale straw body, nice lacing. Aroma is medium sweet, grass, some straw, light melon. Taste is moderately sweet, grass, light melon, bread. Light body, light effervescence, acidity.
Tap at Bambinos. Pale yellow. Almost champagne colored. Grassy and beer aroma. Flavor is pretty tame. Kight biscuit malt and a little bit of piney hops.

Our 3rd beer of the night. After drinking this we decided to look up the definition to learn Pilsners are a type of lager.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Colour...golden straw with a slight haze and a moderately thick head. Nose...opulently floral and gorgeously hopped with notes of citrus and fir needles. Palate...distinctively crisp and pleasingly hoppy with generous hits of pure pilsener flavours. The mid palate flavours are as present as they are at the front and the finish is long and luscious. This pils has ruthlessly shoved aside all others that Ive tried, both old world and new, and it has fast become my most favourite go-to pils.

At the Portland International Beerfest, Saturday June 25, 2015.Clear straw yellow color, white head. Malty, crisp taste. Malty, grainy aftertaste. Medium to fizzy mouthfeel, low bitterness. Malty, grainy scent.

Pale golden with a white head. Aroma is floral, noble, light sweet. Medium, crisp body. Flavor is earthy, czech inspired hopping, light sweet floral notes. Finish is dry and crisp. Very enjoyable pils.

Clear light golden with a blotchy funky white foam. Grassy with some white bread. Fruity, too. Gentle citrus is more often seen in an American Pale. Nice sweet and malty. A good pils and one that stands above.

Bottle @ Tin Bucket. Clear golden pour with a tall white head. Super pretty looking beer. Great bread and fresh dough on the nose. Mild fruity esters and plenty of grassy hops. Sort of leafy and floral as well. There is a pretty sharp bitterness to the palate, but otherwise I very much enjoyed this one. Great malt profile that is pretty crisp. Subtle esters, maybe a touch of soap, and vibrant hops. Pretty nice.
Bottle, shared @ Tin Bucket, RBSG. Medium golden, clear. Florals and light sulfur, pale grains, crisp bitterness. Very nice.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Bottle thanks to Andrew. Pours a cloudy yellow with small creamy white head that lasts. The aroma is grass, floral, grain. Thin mouth, grass, hay, grain, light bitter finish, good.

16.9 oz bottle. Aroma is grassy, fruity, doughy. Pours clear deep golden with a large white head with excellent retention; laces a little. Taste has a nice hoppy bitterness, some faint lemon. One of the best pilsners Ive had.

Bottle from QFC U. Village
I just love it that more and more US breweries are starting to brew solid pilsners. This is a quality addition to that lineup. Relatively light pour for a pils, nice fluffy white head. Super grassy nose, noble hops and some skunk piss. The flavor dances between bready malt almost pushing toward sweetness, and dry noble hops. Mouthfeel is spot on for the style. While distinctively American, this is not an overhopped west coast reinterpretation of a pils with something to prove. Its just a really solid beer.

Bottle pours a clear pale straw/yellow with a large white head. Aroma of spicy grassy hops, dry malt, a touch of honey, and earthy yeast. Upfront hop bitterness and grassy spice, into dry malt, with more hop spice honey and yeast on the finish. Crisp clean and drinkable!

Bottle. Pours a hazy yellow-golden color with a moderate off-white head on there. Nose has a bit of corn to it, but a pleasant amount of grass and floral notes as well. Taste is a bit bitter and quite crisp, and very pleasant to drink. Me gusta.

Une belle clarté dans larôme et dans la superposition des céréales, chaque couche cache une fine membrane gazonnée, parfaite composition. Très croustillant, finale sèche, je me répète mais tout est propre.

A fresh grassy nose. Crisp clean and balanced in the mouth with a silky texture. The flavor of the malt is wonderfully intertwined with the hop character and bitterness. This beer doesnt have stages, it is one glorious flow of flavor that twists and turns intricately.

Bottle.

A: Clear, brilliant gold with a firm cloud-fluff white head and bubble geysers flowing throughout. 

N: Grains, very floral elements - particularly lavender, a bit of nuttiness and some crackling buttered toast, a bit of dough, and a fair amount of leafiness. 

T: Fairly bitter for the style, though the sweetness is noticeable after that initial wave of hops, and this overall, quite clean.

M: Very light bodied, spritzy carbonation, no alcohol.

O: A successful pilsener thats not quite as complex as Heater Allens rendition. Still, this is great for a warm (or cool) spring afternoon, and Id be glad to buy more to share.

Bottle poured. Pours a clear pale color with a ton of head and lacing. Crisp, light bready flavor with a little apple. Cool finish. A little more flavor than your typical pilsner in my opinion. Cracker like flavor finish as well. Tasty pilsner for sure. One of the better Ive had in my short lived experience. Id totally drink this again.

500 ml bottle, bottled on 4/13/15. Crystal clear gold pour with frothy white head, great retention and lacing. Aroma: Honey, grassy, fruity, lemon zest, rubber (like a tire) and some sulfur. Taste: moderately sweet, some biscuit, moderately bitter finish. Palate: light body, light to average carbonation, texture isnt exactly crisp, but this is definitely quaffable. Overall: This is downright pleasant. Not crazy about the rubber, though. Also a bit on the sweet side for my taste, but I expect Ill be picking more of these bottles up.
500 ml bottle. Pours a clear yellow color with a small white head. A big sweet malty pils malt nose. The flavor is big sweet pils malt, toast. Very light crisp hops. Sweet and super smooth. Nice.

Very classy 500 ml bottle from Lifesopurce in Salem OR
$3.99
Golden yellow body with a large thick and frothy white head/
Fine fruity vineous pils malts and grassy hop very good aroma
Taste is the same as the excellent aroma..very pils
Mouth feel is a bit of a let down to be honest, low carbonation leads to some sweetness lingering too long.
A nice pils that could do with some improvment

500ml bottle from Beaumont Market. Pours a crystal clear yellow color with a white head. Aroma is malty, bready, corn, grass. Medium on the palate with average carbonation. Flavor is sweet, bread, a little nutty toast, some grass hops, a little pine, with a clean bitter finish.
On tap at pfriem pub hood river. Pours out a crisp golden topped with a white head. Nose is grassy hops and some spice along with a cereal malt. Taste is as the nose.

On tap at the brewpub - Pours clear pale yellow with a white head. The aroma is bready and crackery with earthy spice, herbs and grass - nice. It has a light crisp body with a light amount of sharp carbonation. The flavor starts drier than the aroma with crackers and crustiness and some spicy hops. The finish has dried grass, sulfur and dry maltiness. Solid pils.

Pours a finger of head on a clear straw body.
The aroma is barnyard dry grain. Nice.
The taste is a dull bitterness throughout.
The texture is crisp with nice fizz.
Its nice, though it doesnt have the sharp pilsner bitter flavor.
Lightly toasted grain, rice, noble hop nose. Flavor is same, initial flash of saaz hops fades to a grainy sweetness, finishing woodsy/earthy. Simple, clean.
Pours gold with a white head. Grass, light lemon, light honey aroma. Light body, light carbonation. Lemon, light honey, sweet corn, light butter, white bread. Nice balance. Good.
Clear straw, dry, has a nice herbal dryness, a classic north Geman pils with character.
Golden yellow in color clear with a thin head. Super Pilsner flavor and finish.Very good Pils and great for a warm day.

Serving: from tap at Zippys Giant Burgers,

Aroma: floral hops.

Appearance: small, frothy, white, initial head with fully diminishing longevity and very good lacing. Clear, light-yellow body.

Taste: light-to-moderately bitter, citrusy initial taste and light-to-moderately bitter, citrusy and nutty finish with average duration.

Palate: light body, watery texture and lively carbonation.

Overall: easy to drink with interesting flavor.

Draught at St. Augustines, VancouverCloudy pale blond color with compact head. Crispy Pilsner, dry, the flavor is slightly better than the aroma, it also has a pleasant mild grassy hop touch.Well brewed.
Draft at the source. Crystal clear yellor, thick white head. Aroma of fresh hay. Smooth, crisp, clean.

Draft at Chucks. Pours a clear medium gold with not much head or lace. Very clean nutty nose, not much crackeriness or grass, but pleasant for sure. Creamy light body with sparkling carb, could use a little more effervescence. Nutty light body, soft toasty finish. Very approachable and clean.
Pours a light yellow. Has a great aroma to it. Grain notes are in the forefront but it is really perky.

On draught at LagerFest at White Owl Social Club. Clear pale yellow color. Aroma is light biscuity malts and grassy hops. Taste is sweet bread malt, corn, and grass hops. Smooth and clean mouthfeel, with a light floral finish.

On draught at lager fest 13, pours clear golden. Nose of grass and biscuit. Taste of grass and biscuits. Slight bitter finish. Good summer beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: NOV 22, 2016 Draft. Lemon-forward and bitter with a lot of raw grassy / herbal hop character, similar to what you get rubbing down hop pellets. And the thing is these appear to be American hops, grassy, juicy, dank and high acid. Snazzy, zesty, very new world-ish which is nice to experience, I love lean hoppy lagers, but it does become bracing and rough and a touch of sweet corn syrup and grain husks, well I wish it were a little smoother and used German hops to not come across as so raw and grating.
On tap at the Platypus. Pours a pale golden color with a fine head that sticks to the glass. Rich malty flavor and some stronger hop bitterness than usual for a pilsner.

On tap at pFriem, pours a clear straw yellow with a medium white head. Nose is full of grassy hops, straw and some cereal. Flavour brings out loads of grassy hops and straw, leaving very dry bitter notes of grassy hops. Very high drinkability. Great pils.

Tap at pFriem, Hood River, 24/05/13.
Clear pale blonde with a thin white head.
Nose is citrus, pale malt, light caramel, cereals.
Taste comprises caramel, citrus, grain, pale malts.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, crisp and clean in the finish.
Decent pils, one of the best Ive tasted in the US.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Draught.  Not quite a pils, not quite a pale lager.  Twould make a serviceable session beer round the fire.  Light aroma, light flavour, clear gold with good white head.
user_location: Munchen an der Willamette, Oregon, USA
